values:
Mister Mordecai, my sweet old Siamese kitty, passed on today. He had developed a nerve center issue that gave him terrible vertigo, and was having a very hard time. I was forced to do the most difficult thing I've ever done, and let him go.

I held him in my arms, stroked and comforted him, told him that I loved him and that he was a very good cat, so he would know that he was safe and loved and I was there for him, and then the doctor put him to sleep gently while I held him in my arms.

In the spring, I'll bury him near Beast, on the farm.

Rest in Peace, Mister Mordecai, Mister Fuzz, Fuzz-nuts, Mister Fuzzinator, my yowly growly Fuzz. I'll miss you. I love you.

God, I hurt right now.
Ben and Sarah's baby was born!!! 7.3 Lbs, 19 inches long!! Name to come once they tell me... but YAY BABY!!!!

So yesterday, I was working in my 'office', AKA The Room With The Modem In It, and, when I was done, I shut down my PC. Once the sounds of the fans had stopped, I heard what sounded a lot like a kid crying, coming from the woods behind my back yard. Needless to say, this caught my attention, particularly when I heard what sounded like a scared little boy calling for his daddy. Concerned, I went out to my back yard, and saw a splash of color in the back woods. I called out, and heard a panicked-sounding "DAD?!" in reply. I said, "no, it's your neighbor, Ted". The response was an equally scared, "TED?!"

My next door neighbor's 4 year old boy had gotten lost in the back woods, during a rainstorm, and couldn't find his way home. He was terrified, covered in burrs, and soaking wet to boot, the poor thing. LUCKILY, I had introduced myself to the neighbors and met the boy (whose name is Ethan) earlier, so he knew it was okay to talk to me at least. Once I helped him get out of the woods and into my yard, I walked him to his driveway and he said that he was all right to get home from there. I made sure he was well up his drive before I walked back to my house.

Poor kid, he must have been stuck out there, lost and terrified for at least 20 minutes, judging from how soaked he was and how many burrs he had accumulated by the time I found him. I can't even imagine how terrified he must have been, lost out there alone in the woods.

So that was my good deed for the day. I'm happy that I was there and heard the poor kid, he must have been scared half out of his mind, lost in the woods during a rain storm and no one coming to help him... I'm glad I could.

So as some of you know, I got into a very serious car accident on Sunday night. I was getting on to 794 in front of the Summerfest grounds in MKE, went to change lanes, and got T-boned by an Acura SUV that was going somewhere around 50-60 MPH. I wasn't in my Jeep - thank god, because I was told that I would definitely have been killed if I had been - I was driving my parents' F250, which saved my life.

Here's what remains of the F250. Bear in mind, also, that this is a TWO TON HAULING TRUCK, that sustained THIS level of damage.

    

I'm amazingly lucky to be alive. No injuries except a mild concussion and some brusing. I was knocked out during the crash, and I can't actually remember it happening. Yeesh. I'm just happy as hell I survived it intact. Someone, somewhere, must be looking out for me.

The birthday thing is going to be at Brocach on Saturday, it seems. 

If anyone can afford to come out, since everyone apparently seems to be broke (and no bitcha to me, you know nothing of poor, Jon Snow), do so. I'll be there, hopefully having some drinks with friends. Or possibly alone. We'll see. 

Also, blah.

Anyone doing anything fun tomorrow, since everyone has the day off?

Also, it's my birthday on Saturday, and I need to decide whether to stay up here in Madison and do Brocach (Since I simply cannot afford to have a big party with a half barrel as I have for the last 8 years in a row), or to go to Milwaukee and go barhopping with some friends down there... I'm leaning fairly strongly towards the MKE thing at this point, as I'm not certain how many people would show up at Brocach if I went there...

Anyone interested in going to MKE with me for my birthday? More than ample crash space is available, and I know all the cool spots to hit down there now... it'll be a lot of fun, and the pubs in MKE are much cheaper than the ones in Madison!

Let a chimp pimp know, yo.

So, despite having paid my rent, the assholes in charge of my apartment building filed in court for eviction ANYWAY, the same day I paid rent. 

So NOW, I need to come up with $89.50, by TOMORROW. Because, of course, the fucking thing needs to be paid BEFORE the 2nd, and since that's MONDAY, I am well and truly fucked. 

Also, my phone will in all probability be shut off again tomorrow or so, since I got a disconnection notice AGAIN today. 

Fucking bastards. 

Fuck ALL of this shit. Fuck it to DEATH.

So, I was bopping about on the internet, reading some spoiler-ey threads here and there, when I came across the neutron frakking bomb of spoilers. I'm talking about the BIG NASTY THREAD OF SPOILER DEATH here. So I read it. I got to the end of the page, and there it was. Seething. Bubbling maliciously. Spewing hatred and terrifying, mind-crushing truths from my screen like a pissed off phalanx of suicidal Spartans facing The Persian Horde. Melting my BRAIN instantly with its devastating power and infernal intent.

I KNOW WHO THE FINAL FIVE ARE.

Dear God. You NEVER saw it coming. Guaranteed. 

Holy.

FRAKKING.

Crap.

What Vampire: the Requiem Vampire clan are you?




Emotional and sensual, the Daeva cultivate both desire among their prey and physical perfection among themselves. Sexual predators and sensual hedonists alike populate the ranks of the clan. Succubus sires look for some combination of charm, culture, seductiveness, desire to achieve, passion and physical beauty. Many Daeva Embrace mortals to whom they have become attached, but this attachment almost invariably proves false, a mixture of lust and simple hunger. Few relationships are as euphoric as those between a Daeva and a newly Embraced childe, and few grow cold as swiftly.

I should have gone with on Saturday. 

I didn't. 

I didn't because I've spent the past 4 or 5 days fighting off the bout of depression that wants to rule my life. I just wasn't up to going out and being sociable. More's the pity, because the only person who missed out on anything as a result of my antisocial mood was me. 

I should have gone. But I didn't. 

Maybe next time.

Typical.

Yeah. Because EXACTLY what I needed right now, was a fucking 5 day notice of eviction unless I pay $442.00 in 'unpaid rent'.

And I would LOVE to know where the FUCK that amount came from. How, precisely, do I owe FOUR HUNDRED FOURTY TWO DOLLARS???

God DAMN it. I did NOT need this right now. 

FUCK.

He is here. He is MIGHTY!!! He is the THUNDER DOG!!!

(He is scared to death of Sneezus, my clawed cat!)

I would post better pictures than a tiny avatar, as I have some now, but first I need somewhere to post them! My account is on the cheap, you see... no pic storage for me. :(

The propane-fueled explosion that blew up the Falk plant in the Menomonee Valley did not cause any damage to me or my apartment. It did wake me up and caused my entire building to shake like a bomb had just hit it at 8:07 this morning, though. Woke me up with the biggest BANG I've ever heard.

I just wanted to let everyone know that I didn't get blown up, in case anyone cared or was wondering for some reason.

Four-story fireball, though. Crazy. Luckily, it looks like there weren't very many serious injuries or deaths. Given the size and power of the explosion, that's a very lucky thing indeed.

If you want to know more about this, check out www.jsonline.com, the Milwaukee Journal-Sentinal's web page.

His work changed my life.

He created most of the X-Men as you know them.

R.I.P., Dave Cockrum. You created worlds.

THIS is the funniest goddamed thing I've seen in months. Possibly years. Holy shit.

It's a Death Metal Parrot. Named Waldo.

No shit. Check the fucking link. I almost pissed my pants laughing. You MUST listen to the mp3s if you can - they're too much.

Wow. My stomach aches and I've got tears running down my face.

PARROT DEATH!!!!

And if that amuses you as much as it did me, go and search for "Caninus". All I can say is, Pit Bull Metal. Seriously.

If you are trying to call me today, and I'm not calling you back, I'm not ignoring you; I left my phone at home in my rush to get to work this morning...

Oops.

http://www.panslabyrinth.com/

Check it out. It's a modern fairy tale - designed by Mike (Hellboy) Mignola, and directed by Guillermo (Hellboy, Blade II) Del Toro. It looks AMAZING.

Ted will go to jail for ...

Setting your partners underwear on fire

'What sexual activity will you go to jail for?' at QuizUniverse.com

Anyone have any sugestions as to the best resources for researching jobs in Chicago? Other than Craigslist, I don't really know where to begin. Any help will be most appreciated.

Thanks!

THIS made me laugh so hard, I still have tears streaming down my face and my stomach muscles ache...

Oh. God.

Too funny.

THIS one is not as funny, but will give you a very... different... view of Yoda.

You Belong in Dublin
Friendly and down to earth, you want to enjoy Europe without snobbery or pretensions. You're the perfect person to go wild on a pub crawl... or enjoy a quiet bike ride through the old part of town.
What European City Do You Belong In?

Happy Birthday to the_capuchin, who is officially OLD today!

;P-

I think that it's going to be Chicago. It just has the best benefits; a great economy, cost of living high but not lethal, huge design and art scene, museums, clubs, pubs and culture, AND it's close enough that I can still come here to visit people in my truck without spending $300 in gas and driving for 3 days.

Now to start looking for info on a job and an apartment that hopefully costs less than a grand a month, and hopefully isn't in a shitty part of town...  (You hearing me here, Clint and Jeremy???)

It's April 30th.

Exactly 2 months from today, I move.

*HOPE*

I never knew that Dave Lombardo (Drummer for Slayer, Grip, Inc. and Fantomas) was Cuban. Yep. Born in Havana.

For that matter, who knew that Tom Araya (Singer/bassist for Slayer) was Chilean? Indeed, he was born in Chile. 

Kind of random.

I have no idea why I thought that any of you would care about this. I just found it interesting.

The Mordecat has arrived. 

That is all.

I saw an AWESOME cat today. He's an 8 year old cream colored Siamese, 4 paw declawed, male, blue eyes, with one crinkly ear. He looks like Bucky from Get Fuzzy! He's a super sweetheart, and his owner has MS, so can't take care of his needs any more, sadly. So if that big boy needs a home, I'm going to give him one. He's loud as sin, but then, Siamese are that way. He's a real love bug though, so I'll deal with it. His name is Mordecai, of all cool things. Anyway, if the owner does finally decide to give him up (and she pretty much has to now, as she's in the hospital at this point), I've applied to take him home. So we'll see - crazy orange gatos or snuggly siamese!

I'm leaning heavily towards moving away from Madison after my lease expires on June 30th. 

I have no job.

No roommate. 

No significant (or even insignificant) other.

No pet, right now.

Nothing holding me here.

Milwaukee is still in the running, but jobs are tough as sin there, too - just not as bad as here.

Chicago is occurring to me more and more often.

A good friend of mine (Non-LJ) just suggested I come out to his place in Rancho Cucomunga (Orange County, outside LA), and set up some interviews to do. Says that the design scene is popping like mad near him. So that's just entered the running, too. Having a friend around is always a big, big positive. 

Atlanta has popped into my head on a few occasions for some reason, but not in any really serious way.

I need to make some serious decisions soon.

My life needs to change. I cannot sit in this rut any more. It's slowly driving me mad. 

So I need to change something; move forward. Will a geographic change do that? I don't know. 

But I'd better start figuring it out right quick.

Hmm.

Any input is more than welcome...

Goodnight, Beast.

I feel wierd as hell going to sleep in my bed without you there, trying to snuggle next to my face. Weirder still, waking without you being there to trill at me. 

I miss you.

I love you, sweet Beast. Tell Bast she gets half of either the Fancy Feast OR the Tuna, not both. The rest is all for you.

I buried Beast in a nice spot, in between her childhood friends, Lady and Bo. She's in the sun, and I planted tulips on her grave. I buried her in her bed, her safe spot, where she slept every day for her whole life, with a can of tuna, a can of her favorite beefy gravy fancy feast, and some of her favorite crunchies. She's chasing chipmunks somewhere happy and sunny right now, with lots of warm laps and soft strokin's for her, and lots of yummy food everywhere, where she never feels bad.

I've never felt so alone in my whole life. I miss her so much already. 

She looked like she was having a good dream when she passed. She was sleeping, and had her little tongue pressed against her teeth, smiling the way she always did when she had her chipmunk-chasing dreams.

I'm gonna take a nap for a few hours, and then I'm going to try to figure out how to cope with all of this. 

Heh. Beast is still laughing at me. The bill for her care was $668.00. The Neighbor of The Beast. Good girl, you goofy Beast. Silly goat.

I'll talk more later, once this overwhelming grief wears off a bit. 

I might go to the Humane Society tonight. I think that might be a good thing. 

We'll see.

Richard Cheese and Lounge Against the Machine are bloody brilliant. Go out and purchase all of their albums immediately.

That is all.

Happy Birthday, DIVABLUEYES!!!


Also, NARF! ;p-

I'm still unemployed.

Starting to get very, very nervous now...

This, however, is the most awesome thing I've read this week:

 
Penny Arcade RULES! ;p-

It's lovely outside right now.

I just got 24 gigs of new music. Rawk.

Thank god for the sun.

I still need a job badly, and this Sunday's updates are not looking encouraging.

Feh.

SUN!

Strangely enough, on the heels of my 'they want to know how much money I want, which means they're interested in me' moment, I got a phone call.

It was from a place I interviewed a few weeks ago in Sun Prairie (not really my favorite place to hang out, but oh, well), telling me that they had, in fact, hired someone, but I was on the short list, and they wanted permission to hold onto my resume, because they're growing fast and may need more people soon.

Permission?

Well sure, yeah, WTF, hold on to it...

It's cool that they called me, I appreciate the consideration that represents.

Weird they asked permission to keep my resume, though. I mean, you already have it... go ahead and hold on to it, if you like!

Hmm.

Well, whatever. Could be wierder. They could have asked permission to chew off my face and feed it to aliens.

Also, narf.

;p-

I just got an email from Culver Advertising Design, the SWEET design firm I interviewed at in the Third Ward last week. They wanted to know what salary range I was looking for. 

I didn't really know what to say. 

I checked online for a salary wizard thingie, and it said the median income was around $46K per year for a Graphic Designer in Milwaukee. Of course, it said a similar number for Madison, which I KNOW is not correct, so...

So I asked for somewhere between $27K and $32K. 

I AM fairly entry-level, after all, and asking for the moon doesn't strike me as a great idea up front. 

I hope I didn't just sell myself short...

But I hope I get the job more!!


HOPING.

Also, I had my interview this morning in Milwaukee at Culver Ad Design (a pretty damned prestigious studio), and it went REALLY well. The interviewer/Creative Director told me that he was going to ask the owner to bring me back in for a second interview in a few weeks once things settle down a bit, and THEN he told me, point by point, what to bring in my portfolio to impress the owner! ROCK. 15 people in the shop, the position is opening because the woman doing it now is being promoted to an art director position with the studio. They're located around the corner from MIAD, in the Third Ward on Milwaukee Street, in a 7th floor office with full view of the lake. SUPER sweet atmosphere. I'm hoping on this one. And I'm doing some projects up to buff my portfolio in the way he asked me to. Oh, yes. I want this one. I actually would LIKE to do this gig, unlike pretty much all of the other places I've interviewed at. HOPING.

The Bad: The pills my vet told me to give to Beast have, as I suspected they would, made her sick. She threw up several times and is refusing to eat now.

Bugger. Well, THOSE bloody pills are being discontinued as of now. I'll have to reconsult with the vet again. Shite. An unhappy Beast makes for an unhapy Me.


The Good: I got a call from Culver Advertising Design a few minutes ago, wanting to interview me next Wednesday for a Production Artist / Designer position in the Third Ward in Milwaukee. So this coming Wednesday, I invade Milwaukee seeking work, living space, and BEER! Ilse, you better get at me about when you get off of work!! ;p-

So, my stepdad's business is in need of a full time office-phone-answerey-typey sort. It's $13.50 an hour, so my mom is going to mention to him that I'd do it. For that kind of cash, I'm not so opposed to doing boring office work...

Also, I got a call today for a preliminary interview at a place in Sun Prairie (it would figure if I got that job - live out there for four years, and then move into the center of the city to be closer to everything else - just in time to need to be closer to Sun Prairie again...) at 8:30 AM tomorrow morning. So at least I've gotten some positive news today.

Overall, my day started awful, and has continually improved as the day has gone on. 

Sweet. :)-
